Beginner.description: Needs concrete, guided tasks and frequent support. Benefits from high scaffolding such as explicit instructions, templates, and step-by-step procedures. Goal is recognition, recall, and basic skill building.
example_activities: Fill out worksheets with clear instructions
Complete partially worked examples focusing on safe online behaviour
Use a basic digital tool for the first time

Intermediate.description: Can apply and modify ideas using frameworks. Benefits from moderate scaffolding through guiding questions or templates. Focus is on applying knowledge and developing reasoning skills.
example_activities: Improve a provided template for digital collaboration
Explain the rationale behind chosen approaches

Advanced.description: Works independently, creates solutions or projects, and reflects critically. Receives minimal scaffolding and more autonomy. Expected to self-evaluate, justify decisions, and reflect on outcomes.
example_activities: Design and manage a collaborative online project
Develop digital communication guidelines for the class
Conduct independent reflection on project outcomes
